intro: Cyathogyne dewevrei, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a unique member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its striking, large, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant has a short, woody stem with broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers emit a strong, sweet fragrance at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
